results.name: Abraham Low Self-Help Systems/Recovery International
results.notes: Self help for anxiety, depression and other mental health issues. Support groups meet weekly at various times and locations throughout Portland metro area; call or visit the website for further details. All are welcome. Donations are requested but not required.

results.name: Asian Health and Service Center
results.notes: Health and community services including: ESL classes, recreation and cultural activities, employment information and consultation, family and youth services, Chinese immersion preschool, mental health assessment/screening, individual and group therapy, case management, addiction assessment/screening/treatment, volunteer services, family caregiver program, womens health promotion project and emergency preparedness.

results.name: Catholic Charities Pregnancy Support and Adoption Services
results.notes: Supportive services to expecting mothers, such as baby and maternity supplies, resource assistance in future planning, professional counseling, and parenting education. Adoption services provided at no cost. For adoptive families we offer: child centered adoptions, home study reports and post placement supervision, special needs adoption (through state foster care). Relationship counseling offered as well.

results.name: Center for Family Success-Rockwood
results.notes: Parenting Inside Out class for parents involved in the criminal justice system with children 18 or younger. Some Spanish-language classes available. Must live in Portland area. Priority given to mandated persons but not required. Free anger management classes.

results.hours: 8:30 a.m.–8 p.m. Mon.-Wed., 8:30 a.m. – 5 p.m. Thurs. and Fri.
results.notes: Provides counseling for victims and offenders of sexual abuse. Psychological testing and evaluation, polygraph exams; anger management treatment. Victims (survivors) of sexual abuse are treated without charge.

results.hours: 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon & Wed; 8 a.m.-7 p.m. Tue & Thur; 8am-noon Fri.
results.name: Clackamas County Family Court Services
results.notes: Relationship and marital counseling for couples; family mediation for parents and children; divorce mediation. Fees: $80/hour, payment plans and waivers available; parent education class $60, but discounted if registered within 45 days of filing/ being served.

results.name: Community Action Opening Doors
results.notes: Connects pregnant women and first time parents with prenatal care and other family services. Provides support, education and advocacy.

results.name: Council for Prostitution Alternatives
results.notes: Helping women escape the sex trade. A drop-in center and safe environment where women meet with staff to explore alternatives to prostitution, receive counseling, and advcacy.

Provides grief support groups for children ages 3-18 and young adults ages 19-30 and their families who have experienced the death of a parent, sibling or a significant person in their life. Bilingual Spanish groups are provided regardless of ability to pay. Donations welcome.

Outreach services to victims of family violence; advocacy, education, and counseling. Adults 18 and older who have experienced family violence at any time in their life may enroll after meeting one-on-one with a counselor or advocate for intake appointment.

results.name: Elders in Action
results.notes: Personal advocates for adults age 60+ in the area of housing, health care, crime and elder abuse.

results.name: Gateway Center For Domestic Violence
results.notes: Gateway Center for Domestic Violence Services aims to create a comprehensive, centrally located center for victims of domestic violence and their children for easier accessibility for information, referrals, resources and services.

results.hours: 8 a.m.- 9 p.m., Mon-Thurs.; 8 a.m.–5 p.m. Fri.; 10 a.m.-3 p.m.
results.name: Good Samaritan Ministries
results.notes: Faith base organization providing counseling, teacher training, and lay counselor training. Counseling includes: family, individual, marriage, men's, women's and teen groups and children; anger management and abuse recovery for offenders and victims.

results.name: Hospice and Palliative Care of Washington County
results.notes: A home-based program designed to meet the special physical needs of terminally ill patients and their families. Care is provided regardless of ability to pay. Call to set up appointments and nurse visit.

results.hours: Contact Harold Cubbedge, irontribe@clear.net 9 a.m. - 9 p.m. Monday - Sunday
results.name: Iron Tribe Support Group
results.notes: Ex-cons in recovery. Resource referrals, peer support, mentoring and fund-raising events.

results.hours: 9 a.m.-5 p.m., Mon.-Thurs.; 9 a.m.-2 p.m., Fri.
results.name: Jewish Family and Child Services
results.notes: Individual, family, couples and group counseling, and parent coaching program. Services provided on a sliding scale. Home care for elderly and disabled. 10-minute phone call to assess clients needs.

results.name: Kids Need Both Parents
results.notes: Counseling and weekly support groups for parents that are breaking up or divorcing and want to be active in their children's lives. Support group meets most monday evenings at 905 NE 11th Ave. from 7:00p.m.-9:00p.m. Please bring photo ID.

results.hours: 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. Mon-Fri. Best to call first.
results.name: Men’s Resource Center and Women’s Counseling Center
results.notes: Anger management for men and women; domestic violence 48-week course with 3 month follow-ups. Alcohol and drug diversion on a sliding scale.

results.hours: 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. Mon-Fri. Best to call first.
results.name: Men’s Resource Center and Women’s Counseling Center
results.notes: Anger management for men and women; domestic violence 48-week course with 3 month follow-ups. Alcohol and drug diversion on a sliding scale.

results.name: Morrison Child and Family Services
results.notes: Outpatient counseling, including individual, group and family counseling as well as crisis intervention and case management. Se hable espanol.

results.hours: Mon.-Thur., 10a-6p; Fri.-Sat., 10a-3p; Open house the second Tue. of month, 10a-1pm
results.name: Mother and Child Education Center
results.notes: Free and confidential pregnancy tests, clothing and supplies for pregnancy and nursing mothers. Small classes and workshops learning from both instructors and peers. Open house 2nd Saturday of every month.

results.name: Multnomah County Family Court Services
results.notes: Parent education, family mediation, relationship counseling and child custody evaluations. Not individual counseling.

results.hours: Mon.-Sat., 9a.m.-5p.m.; Sun., 2p.m.-3:30p.m. After hours by appointment only.
results.notes: Support and education to individuals with mental illness or families of youth with mental illness through classes, support groups, referral and advocacy help.

results.name: Northwest Family Services
results.notes: Free couples classes, parenting, job readiness and placement, youth programs, healthy relationship education. English and Spanish language services.

results.name: Open Door
results.notes: Mental health and housing counseling for homeless, advocacy, information/referral, food-boxes, day shelter, showers, laundry and community kitchen. No ID required. Boundaries: Cornelious, Banks, Forest Grove and Gaston areas only.

results.hours: Mon.,Wed, Thur, 9a.m.-9p.m.; Fri, 9a.m.-5p.m. Tue. 4 p.m.-9 p.m.
results.name: Pacific Psychology Clinic-Pacific University
results.notes: Mental health services- individual, family, child, and group therapy. Also psychological assessments, consultation services after telephone interview and scheduled appointment. Sliding scale fee, $20-$85.

results.address: 615 SW Harrison Portland State University Graduate School of Education
results.hours: 8 a.m.-9 p.m. Mon.-Fri., by appointment only.
results.name: PSU Community Counseling Clinic
results.notes: Individual, couple and family counseling. $15 per session, reduced fees negotiated, 10- week committment. Child counseling also available.

results.hours: 9:00a.m.-4:00p.m., Mon.-Wed.; 9:00a.m.-3:00p.m., Thurs., Reception is closed on Fri.
results.name: Resolutions Northwest
results.notes: Neighborhood and interpersonal issues. No- and low-cost resolution services. Classes for mediation and conflict resolution, Spanish outreach, sliding scale.

results.hours: 9 a.m.- 12 p.m., Mon, Tues and Wed, Thurs. 9:30a-11:30a. Advocacy by appointment Tuesday
results.name: Rose Haven
results.notes: Women only: Assistance with referral for health care, nutrition, hygiene and clothing, advocacy services for housing and legal aid. Mailing address and voice mail.

results.name: Sexual Assault Resource Center (SARC)
results.notes: Provides immediate 24hr response and support to sexually assaulted survivors. Case management, education and outreach programs, support groups and free mental health services. Se hable Espanol.

results.name: Sunnyside Counseling Center
results.notes: Service clients 6 years and older. Depression, family and relationship counseling. $25 processing fee and sliding scale for remainder of care. Personality inventories at intake.

results.name: Survivors of Incest Anonymous
results.notes: 12-step support group.

results.name: Washington County Alcohol/Drug/Gambling Addiction Services
results.notes: Washington County's alcohol/drug/gambling/addiction program provides referrals to treatment, educational materials, presentations concerning addictions and information on treatment options in the county.

results.address: 150 N First Ave. 1st Floor Victim’s Services
results.notes: Center for Victim Services offers assistance to survivors of crime and trauma, including individual, family and group counseling; information sessions for victims.

results.address: 2901 E. Burnside St. at the Quest Center for Integrated Health
results.name: Women of Wisdom
results.notes: Peer and community support for women living with HIV/AIDS. Clothing night for women and children once a month. Provide two meals a week. Massage and acupuncture once a week, by appointment.

results.hours: 9 a.m.–5 p.m. Mon.-Fri. Evening hours by appointment only.
results.name: Youth Contact
results.notes: Counseling services focusing on alcohol, drugs and dependence issues. Beaverton and Hillsboro youths (up to age 18) and their family, call or come in for intake; OHP and some private insurance accepted. Se hable espanol.
